intro: Hieraciodes nana, commonly known as dwarf rock lettuce, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and rocky habitats. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, spoon-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its compact size and drought tolerance make it an ideal choice for landscaping in dry climates. Hieraciodes nana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract beneficial insects.
